oh i see, sorry bro, you are left with only one option, i tried it with steam and worked with other games.

1. Download this version.
2. Delete the game downloaded from steam (NOt manual download, but from steam itself).
3. Copy this one to the folder that steam created when downloading the original game, if you cant memorize the folder, start downloading the game from steam, then quit it after downloading 1 MB, it will create the folder again.
4. Download it again from steam.

Now steam will just replace the only updated files. so the download wont take 1-5 mins max. and you will be able to have all DLCs.

HOW TO GET ADVANCE DISPLAY SETTING TO APPLY: after you select your advance display setting and make any changes after you save it will take you back to the basic display settings there when you select to go back to main menu it will ask to save AGAIN please select no instead of yes and the your advance settings will be applied

FOR THE PEOPLE WHO HAVE THE WHITE SCREEN PROBLEM:Apparently it is because you don't have windows installed on the C: drive.

Here's the solution for it:

There is a way to run it if you have Windows is not on drive C:
Download the file that corresponds to your install location for Sleeping Dogs :

rghost(.)ru_/_39910276 if windows is in D:
rghost(.)ru _/_39910718 if windows is in E:
rghost(.)ru _/_39909929 if windows is in G:

Just extract and then copy the files in game directory. Found this guide somewhere, worked for me, just passing it along so people can solve their problem with the game.
